item.title: [Python] Deeper about subprocess (3 series, updated version)
item.description: #Introduction Article I wrote in 2017Thecontentsarebasedon2series,andIthoughtthatitwouldbebettertoupdatetheinformation,andasaresultofstartingediting,Thisarticlewasnewlycreatedbecauseitbecamenecessarytoaddalargeamountofpostscript,includingsubprocess.run(). As a goal, while explaining the subprocess function from before (support is not finished), we will make synonymous descriptions with subprocess.run() and subprocess.Popen(). Furthermore, we will discuss more diverse descriptions using these. If you are in a hurry, you can read the common rules of cmd description and run() and later, and there will be no problem. The story of what the module does in the first place is officialorthisarticle.
